title: Residency Shift Scheduling
userMessage: What is Yale Policy on residents shifts during high volume hours?
assistantMessage: To help residents manage excessive clinical volume, Yale requires that shifts overlap during high volume hours. This overlap is intended to allow residents to finish their shifts on time while ensuring a safe transition of patient care. On busy services, service requirements are adjusted so that more residents are scheduled concurrently to properly share the workload and mitigate fatigue...

title: Equipment Purchase
userMessage: Can Yale Radiology faculties spend funding from their staff accounts on Amazon purchases?
assistantMessage: Faculty funds for staff accounts are designated to cover work-related activities and professional development expenses. The policy explicitly states that “No Amazon purchases are allowed unless pre-approved by the business office.

title: Contrast Reaction Documentation
userMessage: How should I document a contrast reaction event?
assistantMessage: Below are the key documentation requirements for a contrast reaction event as outlined in the guidelines: • Document the event in the patient’s medical record (Epic) by including: The contrast agent used and the dose administered A clear description of the reaction signs and symptoms (e.g., type and severity) Details of patient management (for example, medications or interventions provided) Patient outcome and any relevant discharge instructions • The radiologist should also document the contrast administration details and the adverse event in the radiology report whenever possible. • In addition, the technologist must report the incident in the SAFER Event Reporting System.
